title: 'Watershed': Lavarch to lead review of NSW Labor
text:
Former federal attorney-general Michael Lavarch said NSW Labor's grassroots members are dispirited over the conduct of the party's officials, as he started a review into the scandal-plagued branch.

Federal Labor leader Anthony Albanese and NSW leader Jodi McKay announced Professor Lavarch's appointment to scrutinise the branch and its head office in the wake of damaging Independent Commission Against Corruption hearings into allegations over fundraising.

From left, NSW Opposition Leader Jodie McKay joins, Federal Opposition Leader Anthony Albanese and Professor Michael Lavarch on Sunday.

For the first part of his review, Professor Lavarch will examine Labor's head office, in particular the powers concentrated in the role of general-secretary, who as well being the party's administrative head and campaign director also convenes the dominant Right faction.

Professor Lavarch will then scrutinise the party's compliance with donations and electoral laws.

The position of general secretary will not be filled until the review is complete. The current general secretary, Kaila Murnain, was suspended from the job after she gave evidence to the ICAC that she kept quiet about an alleged illegal donation from Chinese property developer Huang Xiangmo.
